sentences.sentence: I have had enough obloquy for one lifetime.
"His long public life, so singularly checkered with good and evil, with glory and obloquy" (Macaulay).
sentences.translation: 他长期从事公务，好的和坏的，光荣和受辱交错，盛衰无常(麦考利)。

sentences.sentence: He has faced obloquy and condemnation from Israel and Jewish groups worldwide in the wake of its findings.
sentences.translation: 由于该报告所揭露的内容，他遭到以色列人以及全世界的犹太团体的毁谤和谴责。
